channel.title: Packages help
channel.description:
I need some help with packages. Here's my problem example.
I have a folder on my desktop.. [img]http://i12.tinypic.com/6bv8u1x.jpg[/img]
then within the test folder I have a couple .java files with just some test methods & stuff. I have the:
[code=java]package com.penguins.test;[/code] at the top of each .java file. Then I'm trying to have a file in the /src folder use the methods in the packaged? files, but "cannot find symbol" of the methods.
I read a tutorial on google, but I didn't really understand setting the classpath part.. http://www.jarticles.com/package/package_eng.html
Thank ya.

item.title: Packages help
item.dc:creator: @Penguins Penguins
item.description:
@Penguins wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:2, topic:137935”]several options here:
make the methods in classes Read and Display static, then you use Display.show(…) and Read.getString(…)
or without making them static, new Read().getString(…) and new Display().show(…)[/quote]

Thank you. Solved.

Read full topic

item.title: Packages help
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

or you could staticly import them

item.title: Packages help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Penguins,

frank_:

the packaged classes should be in the relevant package directory

That means that they should be in /com/penguins/test/.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

LOL. Dude, go read a book… seriously…

Read full topic

item.title: Packages help
item.dc:creator: @Penguins Penguins
item.description:
@Penguins wrote:

Yes, I did import the package.

Maybe you can spot the mistake.

[tt][b]Display.java[/tt]

[code=java]
package com.penguins.test;

public class Display {

public void show(String s) {
	System.out.println(s);
}

}[/code]

[tt]Read.java[/tt]

[code=java]
package com.penguins.test;

public class Read {

public void getString(java.util.Scanner scnr, String str) {
	str = scnr.nextLine();
}

}[/code]

[tt]Test.java[/tt]

[code=java]
import com.penguins.test.*;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class Test {

public static void main(String[] args) {
	Scanner scnr = new Scanner(System.in);
	String str;

	getString(scnr, str);
	show(str);
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
